alert.note: Alert for Eddy (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 21 at 1:45PM MDT until August 23 at 12:56PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Midland/Odessa TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Mexico... Pecos River near Artesia 6E affecting Eddy County. .Thunderstorms producing very heavy rainfall have produced abundant rainfall on the Pecos watershed upstream of Artesia. The Pecos River at Artesia is expected to rise into flood over the next couple of days, before receding through the end of the week. For the Pecos River...including Artesia 6E...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pecos River near Artesia 6E. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon to early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, the river reaches bankfull. Overbank flooding occurs about 1/2 mile upstream from the gage and spreads onto the flood plain. As a result, river width increases to approximately 1 mile in some reaches. Minor flooding of low-lying areas occurs, but no significant damage is expected. At 12.5 feet, the river reaches minor flood stage. Structures at Wilbank Trucking, Inc., located approximately 1/4 mile east of the gage, begin to flood. At 13.5 feet, the river reaches the floor of the instrument shelter. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 6.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 12.9 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and forecasts (feet): Fld Observed Sun Mon Mon Tue Location Stg Stg Day/Time 6pm 6am 6pm 6am Pecos River Artesia 6E 12.5 6.7 Sun 1pm 7.0 9.3 12.7 10.3 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 145 AM MDT.
